dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 13, 2022
reviews: \nI almost never leave ratings or comments but In this case I had to.I upgraded from Alexa Gen 4 but am very disappointed. Day 1 [3 days ago] the device would not set up fully, after 2 hours on phone with tech support it fully worked. Hung up and 5 minutes later it stopped working. Since then I have called tech support 5 times but to no avail. One time I was yelled it, twice hung up on, once told Alexa couldn\u2019t do anything but play music, another time was told to call light bulb manufacturer etc. After all this the device is still not fully working!All agents do not listen (except the very first one I spoke with. God, I wish I could talk to her again.  She was AMAZING!  If anyone at Amazon reads this please look up who that was and please have her call me?) Agents are hell bound to have you pair. No matter the issue you WILL pair the device. I told them many times my device is paired and that\u2019s not the problem but it falls on deaf ears.  YOU WILL PAIR.  PAIR AGAIN. PAIR AGAIN. PAIR AGAIN.  PAIR AGAIN. Ad nauseam.  The agents only seem trained to do that one thing and if your issue varies from that script they learned in training they have no clue what to do so, PAIR AGAIN! Finally they admit defeat to themselves then they do their best to get you off the phone; by hanging up or just not talking or, giving you some BS about something irrelevant (eg Firestick, ITunes etc.)  They have \u201cno supervisor\u201d or, they claim to be \u201ca supervisor\u201d which is very doubtful when they didn\u2019t even know there even is a 5th generation or do not know that Alexa can turn lights on /off.Back to the hardware, the 5th Gen constantly turns my IPhone Bluetooth off even though it needs it to work.  An unmentioned  \u201cupgrade\u201d I found on the 5th Gen is when you turn the device on you are forced to hear random music from Amazon music which you can not stop or pause until at least 15-20 seconds elapse.  BTW the \u201cupgrade\u201d to the music occurs every time it turns your Bluetooth off and you must turn it back on, which like I said, mine is doing all the time.The 5th Gen also doesn\u2019t seem to hear as well as the 4th Gen did.  At least 50% of the time when asking Alexa a question I get the response  \u201cI\u2019m having trouble hearing\u201d and I\u2019m only 3 feet from her with no background noise.Regarding sound quality, I am a huge music fan and I only hear a very slight improvement over my 4th Gen, not enough to justify upgrading if music quality is your deciding factor IMO; however; my partner hears a big difference so maybe it depends on music genre (Our preferred genres are polar opposites,)I considered that I may have gotten a \u201cdud\u201d or a \u201clemon\u201d device but Amazon refuses to even consider that because they can \u2018see\u2019 the device online, however to me that only shows the WiFi on the Gen 5 works, but not necessarily all the other functions (ie Bluetooth etc.) but it\u2019s my theory vs Amazon.I really want my 5th Gen to work and to love it as I did my Gen 4 but after 3 days and many frustrating calls I think I may return it and go back to my 4th Gen.I think the 5th Gen could be great but it needs more time in beta testing and/or a complete \u201cdo-over\u201d.  IMO I would advise others to wait until a new version of Gen 5 is available or even Gen 6 is available.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 20, 2022
reviews: \nThis product is so much fun! I have it hooked up to a smart light and all I have to say is \u201cAlexa, turn on the lamp\u201d and bam on comes the lamp. It is so handy to me because the switch for my lamp is clear behind my bed so to get to it is a pain.  But now I can ask Alexa to do it and no more blindly trying to find the switch.When I want to listen to Pandora, all I have to say is \u201cAlexa play pandora\u201d and bam it starts playing. Ask her the weather, bam she knows it and tells it. It is so nice and handy.The sound quality is super! It sounds like a big speaker playing but actually this big sound is coming from this small speaker.I\u2019m so glad I bought this product. It can do so much more I just need to play around with it more. So fun! And so handy!\n

reviews: \nYou can pretty much ask her anything like having a buttleress, she is so smart and Alexa can even turn on power outlets for lights, fan and I even turn on my in sink erator or sink grinder using alexa. You can make it connect to your bluetooth speakers and the music will play thru your bigger and better sounding bluetooth speakers, it can also pair all your alexa enabled speakers so you can play the songs all over the house. Any gadget that shows Alexa enabled this little echo can control it. It can dim your lights and switches that are Alexa enabled, unlimited possibilities. I might look into the car echo because I read that it can control a few things like start the car, turn on the heater, etc.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 11, 2023
reviews: \nBought two of these in December using some shopping points via Kohls.Specifically bought them as I have a Ring Pro alarm system with Eero intergrated and wanted to use these for their wireless repeater ability...Initially set one up in the room with the Ring Pro and one on the far side of the house - ok, that works well, Eero picks it up and lets me set up the repeat abilityThen I move it to my sunroom, just past the living room (where the ring pro is) - works fineThen I move it to the game room, it's intended position - works great for the better part of 2 monthsabout a week ago (start of April) it would give me messages that it couldn't find devices online when I asked to control smart home.  Check the Alexa app - it's offline, Check EERO app, it's "having trouble connecting"Attempt automatic and manual rebuilds, 2, 3 times.  Both from where it was in the Game roomthen moving it within line of sight of the main router, less than 30 ft away in the SunroomWould not connect.Google Echo Warranty support - 1 year.Good, that's to be expected, all my previous echos had that kind of warranty...Chat up amazon support - oh, so sorry, it's no longer under warrantyWHAT?!?  - 3 month warranty now.Honestly...Between my echo shows constantly showing me news \\ opinions \\ ads etc even when I turn off every feature for my home screen content (and of course every time they add one... *if* you get to unselect it, it's always opt out and not "opt in" to begin with.  Followed by those three words that start to infuriate me more than anything else "BY THE WAY...."  which after the news of echo supposedly "losing" amazon money has become infuriatingly more common...oh and Ring Pro, with EERO... the radio system that can't even transmit more than 50 ft if there's 1950's drywall and a brick wall between you and it.  with no ability to turn off wifi or even manipulate the channel to get best performance (because I have to use another network to make my stuff work and Eero seems to think the "best" and "clearest" channel is ... you guessed it, the one my other system is on.Honestly, the customer service rep gave me a gift card credit for another one, but I won't be buying it.I just wish Google / Nest was a functional alternative ... because everything I see, it works with fewer things and has less ability with routines etc.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 2, 2023
titles: Both 4 & 5 Gen similar good sound quality
reviews: \nI use an older hockey puck style Echo every day, and looked forward to what I thought would be a big improvement in sound.The Echo is my main audio  device and I would gladly pay more for something that worked really well. Esp. with Amazon music service, I guarantee there are a lot of people who rely on it the same way, and I don't understand why Echoes aren't basically just high quality speakers you can interact with. They're more like an interactive device that happens to have a not great speaker attached.The blue shade is pretty and unexpected for an electronic device, so I was happy with that, but totally underwhelmed by the sound. It's only a hair clearer than my older Echo, but basically no difference - plus there was an annoying fuzzy background noise. Curiously, the Alexa voice volume was not consistent, though that may not be the device's issue.It also shocked me three times as I set it up. I was barefoot on a hard floor so I'm not sure that it was just static electricity. Did I get a wonky one? Quality control is high, but the rare glitch is inevitable, so if so, it's not a big deal. Or maybe the box was dropped in shipping and something came loose.Or maybe it really was just static. The point is that I recognize my experience may not be representative of this item as a whole. Whatever the cause, I was not impressed with the new Echo's performance and returned it.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 10, 2023
titles: What has happened to multi-room music
reviews: \nI have used multi-room music for years and have had no issues.....music play all day on all devices.  A few months ago, I started upgrading some of my old echos and dots for newer models.  Since that time I have had nothing but problems.  They will not stay connected to the network that they are assigned.  I have spent hours trying to fix this problem.  Numerous calls to my internet provider....who sees no reason for this to happen as the bandwidth is good.  Many calls to Amazon always to get someone who knows less than I do...telling me to contact my internet provider.  I have deleted all my saved passwords and tried to reset all the devices multiple times.....yet for some reason they sill remember the password to my other network and jump over to it.  I write this review because I wonder if others are having this issue....there certainly is NO support for this and no other way to report the problem.  For example...one of my new echos has been configured to my 2.4 network (remember I have deleted my passwords to my 5G)......it will be connected tot he 2.4....and a couple hours later it has moved to the 5G.  I believe this is an Amazon problem.  It is interesting that this all started about the time Amazon started laying off echo device personnel.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 1, 2023
reviews: \nIt\u2019s honestly kind of a cool thing, never owning one to getting one with smart bulbs made life super easy. I also connected my vacuum to it which was pretty cool. My main two biggest / three biggest complaints are SoundCloud is not supported on it and the only streaming service I use. I\u2019ve been using it for years because how they treat artists. My second big complaint is UE Boom is not supported either and that\u2019s speaker I use, specifically because of its sound quality. And my third complaint is there\u2019s no internal battery in the dot, I like taking a shower with music, so having to unplug it and plug it back in so I can shower is just a pain in the ass. I can honestly look past one of these things, but all 3 is a complete deal breaker. So now I\u2019m retuning the dot and the light bulbs because they don\u2019t pair with the things already in my life.The pros are Alex is super cool, I like the easy access to alarms, music (Amazon music), info and all sorts of other things and the super plus is waking up with lights\u2026 that part is the coolest because I struggle to wake up in general.But the cons with everything else just makes it not worth it to me to me personally. Now let\u2019s say I had a different speaker and used Spotify\u2026 I would have been 100% sold.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 10, 2022
reviews: \n....that a white cord should go with the charcoal echo?  One buys a dark color when you want to have a speaker that is not so obvious.  Add a white cord and plug to a dark colored speaker????  Beyond ugly and obvious.  I may just end up wrapping black tape around the cord and plug in an effort to hide the glaringly white cord and plug.This device was replacing a Gen 1 Alexa after getting an updated router that could not connect with Gen 1.  The Alexa App is almost useless if there are challenges to hookups.  I spent way too much time trying to get the "old" Alexa to work.  The suggestion that eventually made by Alexa herself was to look at app and manually set up Gen 1.  As hard as I looked, I could not find a link that indicated "manually connect."  Problem could be solved by indicating that on first page that lists the different Echo/Alexa devices and indicate Gen 1 has a specific and different setup.All that being said, I have come to appreciate having Alexa - setting timers and alarms, notifications for packages, listening to music, etc.  I also like that Alexa is smaller than the original tower Gen. 1 and has similar quality for acoustics.The new Gen 5 Alexa is working much the same as the old one.  I can't hear a difference in sound quality though the older version had good sound quality as well.  Upgrades are inevitable -- just wish the process was easier and less frustrating.  Hooking up the Gen 5 was easy; working through the problems with Gen 1 were not.  The 3 star rating is for the white cord and for difficulties with the app.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

titles: Great product  but need to reduce ads
reviews: \nAlexa Dot 5 is a quality product.Sound is great for everyday listening. They have come a long way since the original dot. The problem is, who wants to use it when it's main function now  seems to be nothing but playing  Amazon ads.'By the way', Alexa has been a great help to handicapped individuals. Great for everything from turning on lights to operating oven and microwave if blind.I realize Amazon' s  goal is to make a profit.  However commercial creep has become such a problem that it the product is more of an irritation than help to many people. Who wants to be blasted with a 30 second commercial first thing in the morning, when all you wanted was the temperature?I have purchased numerous  MP3 songs and albums from Amazon.  I have been able to play the playlists of music I  purchased from Amazon on the Alexa , also purchased from Amazon, with no interruption.. Recently I thought I would relax with  my playlist of 30 songs , only to find out Amazon  does it  again!  All of a sudden. I  now have to deal with at least  15 very annoying  "commercial breaks" in a 30 song list.I will probably go an alternative route for music. Who wants to assault guests in your home to Amazon commercials when all you wanted was to provide some background music?Maybe Amazon should have offered an ad free option at purchase like the Kindle. They have taken a good thing and completely botched it up.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 20, 2022
titles: AVOID. This thing is really crummy-- get the 4th Gen dot or something else.
reviews: \nI own two Dots (yay) and two Flexes (boo) already, so this is a comparison.The sound on this one doesn't really sound better than the dot-- it has bass to it, but it makes it sound more like the crummy bass in a clock-radio.The buttons that are historically so visible on top of the other Echo's are, here, completely black, to match the background they are on. They are not illuminated. You just have to feel around and guess.IT HAS NO OUTPUT JACK-- no headphones, no external speakers (except Bluetooth).The indicator light is on the frigging BOTTOM, and the way the shape of the thing is, I'm sitting about three feet away from it, at a desk, and when the light goes on, I can only see a small sliver of it.Also, by default (I don't remember the others being like this), it does not make any sound when woken up. Like, the only indication I have that it has heard me is this small bit of light I have to be looking at. I bet there's a way to turn that on, but why should anyone have to figure that out?Anyway, it's going back. I'll probably get a Gen 4 dot or something. No headphone jack. What are they? Apple?\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 2, 2023
reviews: \nI had 13 of these spread through my home as I wanted music throughout my home.  One day only some worked, so I called customer service to help.  SEVEN hours later, being disconnected 3 times and going through the same \u201cproblem solving\u201d tricks sometimes 4 times, I had fewer working than when I started.  7 no longer did more than tell time.  I asked for them to be replaced given Amazon took 7 hours and made the situation much worse.  I was sent an email that said once I ordered and received 7 new ones (nearly $400) I would be issued a refund.When I didn\u2019t get my refund I called to obtain it.  Amazon refused to honor the email that they themselves sent and could read.  In that sequence I was disconnected and LAUGHED at over my insistence that Amazon honor the email I received.  They refused and weren\u2019t even polite about it.  That series of calls was utterly horrible as they were snotty, arrogant thought this was funny and rude and took and additional hour and a half to get no where.  I would NOT have ordered 7 more of these but for the email saying I was going to be refunded the cost of them.Now they want me to return the ones that don\u2019t work or the new ones though the email makes no notice of my obligation to do more than buy more of them in order to get a refund.  Again the email did not obligate me to return anything.  Nor should I have to after 7 exhausting hours on the phone and I was left worse off after dealing with \u201ccustomer service.\u201dIt will take me 2 hours plus gas to get to a place to return either the new Echos or the damaged ones.  Plus they will keep my money for 2+weeks before refunding my $400.So now I own 20 of these things.  7 don\u2019t work.  7 in a box and I already know that customer support likely will not (given I was worse off having called them) make them function nor will they support their products.  Either in actuality or even politely.  So basically 14 of the 20 I have are useless to me ballpark $800.  Plus by the time I get to returning them IF I can as I don\u2019t have time to get to a UPS store I will have nearly 12 hours in this process and I still will not only have fewer working Echos than when I started but the grief, aggravation and rude treatment I have been subjected to.And given they refuse to honor their own emails on this I have zero hope that they will honor any refund I\u2019m due whether I send the new ones back or the 7 I have that don\u2019t work.  I\u2019ve asked that they contact me to resolve this and they have not!At all times I did EVERYTHING Amazon asked me to do.  Whether it was how to fix what I had or get new ones to fix the problem.  Their support staff is incapable of fixing problems and they DO NOT HONOR their OWN emails.  Making their promise my problems.Stay away!!!!!!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 2, 2023
titles: Limited Temperature Limits in Alexa Routines
reviews: \nI purchased the Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) specifically to enable the use of the temperature capability to trigger an action in an Alexa routine.  After receiving it, it appears that the temperature trigger in Alexa only goes down to 35 or 36 degrees.  I needed this to trigger once it gets close to freezing (to turn on a pool pump).I'm not sure if this is a Dot limit (maybe due to its operating temperature limits) or Alexa routine limit, but this was disappointing as there don't appear to be Alexa routine "temperature" trigger options other than with the Echo Dot.\n

reviews: \nWe have an Adobe house. The walls a 2 feet thick. I could not get WiFi into the far rooms and bedrooms. Now I can! This unit works great with my other 4th gen echo dots. The WiFi works great. I love the Alexa sound too!  I am making routines and having fun \U0001f929 I admit I did have a week or two of WiFi / setting issues. I had a steep learning curve.  But now it\u2019s great. Alexa is part of the family now. I use her with smart plugs and my Amazon fire stick. I love it when she turns on my tv to my favorite channel. Now I look for more ways to write routines. Just buy one \u261d\ufe0f\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 18, 2023
reviews: \nWe have 5 Echo Dots in our home and one finally gave up the ghost and quit finding the wifi that everyone else could find.When ordering a replacement we decided to go up a model, pay the extra money and spoil ourselves with even better sound for the workout room.Sadly, the better sound is limited (on mine) solely to the speaking voice. The music distorts on medium levels. I find my old echos (the flatter disc ones) actually do better at the higher volumes. It was awkward showing my husband after selling him on the more expensive model. A real \u201coops!\u201d moment.Maybe it was just mine - but it had me wondering if it was pre-used or rebuilt. Not what I expected and I won\u2019t be buying any more of this model.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 6, 2023
reviews: \nI bought this Echo Dot to replace a 5 year old Echo Dot Gen 2 that bricked itself.This was as close as I could get to my original. And I absolutely dislike the form factor. It is very prone to triggering on it's own. Just when I'm talking on the phone, not even saying words close to the trigger word. And has frightened me a few times when I talked about a friend who passed and it telling me I need to seek help if I'm feeling depressed. WTF.It has no stereo port jack like my old one did. The previous is now e-waste and I am pretty certain this new one won't last as long as my Gen 2 did.Many features I original bought Alexa for have been downgraded or removed. I use to have it play music from my collection, but now it drops bits and the song breaks up. (Yes I've checked the wifi,  I can stream to laptops and phones just fine.)SInce I have Amazon Smart Switches, I only use it to turn my lights on and off by command and my coffee maker.I'm pretty sure this is the last Echo Dot I'm going to buy.\n

reviews: \nOverall, the device works well.  However, I bought it for a specific purpose, and that is to allow me to talk to persons who are at the front door through the ring doorbell. titles: Worst echo dot, buy other generations
reviews: \nI was extremely disappointed with the Echo Dot 5th generation that I recently purchased from Amazon. Upon setting it up, I discovered that it was unable to be added to my favorites list in the Alexa app, which was a major inconvenience. Additionally, the temperature sensing feature that was advertised as a new addition to this model did not work at all in Routines - no matter how cold it was in my room, the Echo Dot did not help me adjust the AC temperature as promised. Overall, I would not recommend the Echo Dot 5th generation to others due to these issues.In the picture, you can see the Bath echo(4th) shows a echo dot icon, but the Echo dot(5th) shows a wifi device icon. I guess this is reason that 5th not work well, so do not buy this till they fix it.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 18, 2023
titles: Amazon does not uphold their protection plan
reviews: \nPurchased a brand new 5th gen dot to replace a 1st gen that had lasted for 5 years as well as a 2 year protection plan. It had problems from day one and after less than 4 months, completely stopped connecting to the network and uninstalled all Amazon lights that are in the house. Contacted customer service and was told I would need to call back in an hour as tech support needed to figure out the problem. They then told me tech support would be able to call me back as they were very busy but it would take an hour. Over an hour passed with no phone call. Contacted customer support again and it was determined the unit was defective but the window to return had passed, They would send a replacement for the defective item that was purchased NEW, not a refurb. Replacement arrived today with "Reacondcionado certificado" plastered across the box as well as another sticker on it. Contacted custom support again and was informed that "just because I had the protection plan, it does not guarantee I will get a new echo dot. I will get whatever is in the warehouse at the time - refurbished or new. The protection plan is with 3rd party and only covers defective items". Amazon apparently sells protection plans but does not uphold them, and you are rolling the dice when it comes to what you may get as a replacement for defective electronics. I will only be buying electronics from Best Buy as they actually guarantee what you buy and don't fob off whatever they have in stock. If I had wanted a refurb'ed item, that costs LESS!, I would have purchased that.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 2, 2023
titles: Okay for $30 but not great. Sound is weak & setup was (beyond) fraught.
reviews: \nThe setup almost made me insane. After permuting all the setup variables over several hours  I was about to send it back when the Bluetooth setup finally worked. My experience with Bluetooth over the years is that it's inherently messed up: setup is usually difficult and often impossible. The user interface was designed by gamers using an 8-bit interface in 1980 and has never been brought into the user friendly zone. Alexa bites off way more than she can chew. She might be okay if she let you drive her but she's a know-it-all who takes charge with all the false assumptions you could imagine.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 21, 2022
reviews: \nI have the Echo Dot 4th Gen, and this is not a noticable improvement in sound quality for most of my listening.  I tend to listen to jazz, classical, and folk music, and also I really like to use the Dot with a battery attachment accessory so I can take it with me around the house, garage, and shed.  That is another reason why only 3 stars.  This is not compatible with previous battery configurations, and that is not clear in the listing since there is no picture of the back of the unit to compare.  In addition, there is no stereo out port as there has been on all other Echo and Dot devices.  I'm a big Echo fan, and use the Amazon ecosystem extensively, but I am disappointed by this poor "upgrade" that takes away more than it gives.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 1, 2022
reviews: \n-Update 12/9/22I thought the issue may be with that particular speaker. After getting nowhere with Amazon support I decided to return the speaker and get another one, hoping that would work better. Still the same issue. When I paired this with the Echo Studio it caused both devices to constantly skip songs, or just shut off entirely. Not just every once in a while, but every other song! When I play music on the Studio alone there is no issue. When I try playing the group with the Dot and the Studio together the Dot messes up both of them. This is obviously an issue with the new Echo Dot that needs to be fixed. Does anyone know of any other device I can pair with my Studio to have surround sound in my clinic? I am giving up on this new Dot. I would not recommend it at all if you plan on pairing it with another device because it will cause both of them to have an issue.I bought this speaker on Black Friday to pair with the echo studio I have at work. I have been attempting to use it for the past three days. It constantly disconnects from the Internet and will stop playing music, then randomly start playing another song. I have performed a factory reset on both devices at least three times, disconnected and reconnected to the Internet, contacted tech-support, and still nothing. It continues to stop playing songs randomly, or skips to another song.I contacted Amazon support, which was abysmal. After spending an hour talking to someone I finally gave up. I want to return this device and get a replacement. They told me they canceled the replacement and cannot send a new echo for some reason. I told them I wanted to return the original and get a replacement product for it. And they told me they canceled the replacement product and could not send one to me. I am very frustrated because I had high hopes for this new model. The sound quality was decent, but the connectivity was terrible. It disconnected from the Internet every 5 to 10 minutes and I would have to go back into the Alexa app to start playing music again. Even though I paired it with the studio, it would not let me control the devices in the group that I created. I was hoping that maybe there was just a glitch with the one I received and a new one would work better. But apparently the replacement was canceled and they cannot send a new one for some unknown reason. So I will have to go back and buy it at double the price because it is no longer black Friday. So that is frustrating.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 13, 2022
titles: Not as good as I had expected.
reviews: \nI bought two Echo Dots, the newest ones. One would turn off shortly after I turned it on. I\u2019d tell Alexa, again, what radio station to play, and it would continue to play until I turned it off. The other Dot would turn off within about a minute of turning it on, and I\u2019d tell Alexa to turn on again, and it would turn off within a few minutes from that. I never played them both at the same time so competing for Wi-Fi was not the issue. I expected better from the new 2022 Echo. I sent them both back to Amazon.\n

reviews: \nI first purchased one Echo 5th generation for my kitchen to help hear my new 43 inch Amazon Fire Hands Free TV in my kitchen, it worked fine.  When I purchased my 2nd 5th generation for my new TV in my bedroom, I was on the phone with Amazon for hours for several days trying to get the two units to work.  If I had TV sound in the kitchen, I did not have TV sound in the bedroom.  After hours of speaking to different agents, that problem has been fixed. dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 16, 2022
titles: It works great!!!must have it on
reviews: \nThe built-in Eero Mesh Network Extender capability was the basis of appeal\u2026. It is absolute junk on that front.It doesn\u2019t extend coverage at all. I bought two with the intention of replacing my Eero extenders since I have an Echo in every room anyway\u2026 they won\u2019t allow more than 1-2 things to connect to them. I have a smart faucet IN THE SAME ROOM as one of these \u201cextenders\u201d but the faucet is sending Poor WiFi range errors because it is connecting to my router on the opposite side of the house instead of the Echo extender 3 feet away!I do find that my phone will connect to the one by the couch when I\u2019m sitting within 12 inches from it.I tried to contact customer support\u2026 what a joke that was!!! The customer support people barely speak English and had NO CLUE what I was talking about so I spent 10 minutes of my life answering questions like \u201cis it plugged in?\u201d Instead if someone ACTUALLY PAYING ATTENTION and helping me with the issue!!!My guess is that Echo tech is just not quite there yet. This product will be pretty great in 2-3years though.Update: after posting this, I was contacted by Amazon Customer Service (in America)She was super helpful but unfortunately the issue stands\u2026. As an Echo.. it\u2019s great! As a wifi extender, it has a long way to go.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 16, 2023
reviews: \nI bought two of these in December because they seemed to work well with friends. In the 5 months I've had them, they disconnect all the time and have to be set up again. Changing the default settings (like music) from Amazon music to anything else (I use Spotify) doesn't always work. Sometimes the devices play music on your preferred account, other times it screams that it can't find what you're looking for on Amazon, so it can't play it. As of now, both of my devices can play music if I select them as the current device on Spotify, but they won't recognize my voice at all. The mic is on, it turns blue when I say "Alexa", but it quickly stops listening and doesn't respond to a thing I say. I've tried going through all of the reset options recommended by Amazon, and nothing actually works. The Alexa says it is successfully connected to my network, but time after time, it fails to do anything.On a regular day, Alexa either understands what I'm saying clearly, or misses every other word. It seems to change by the hour. I understand hearing the wrong synonym, but it would frequently start responding to things nowhere near what I had asked.If you want a smart device, you're better off sticking with Google.\n

titles: Dumbest "smart" device on the market - Amazon should stay out of the smart device market

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 16, 2023
reviews: \nI bought it for my Grandma and she actually uses it......to check the weather mostly. But she has started to get some use out of it for music lately. I hate that she cant just pick music she wants to hear. She asks for a song amd it just advertises again and again sometimes about ways she could hear tge song she wants for a subscription to something extra every month. I mean we got Prime and we have the Alexa now along with a thousand amazon purchases each year. So why cant it just play the song she wants from the 60s without me having to add another 20 dollars in fees each month. We tried to just oay tye unlimted music plan to get it for her. But then amazon said, no you gotta have a seperate monthly fee to use your subscription on the alexa device. I mean the T.V. can play the unlimited music app, and my our phones. I can stream it to the home speaker system too and ask alexa on my phone to stream it to the speakers and it works. But my grandma cant do all that extra nonsense. She just wants to hear her songs and wants it to answer 2 questions a week about the weather. And it wont do that unless you pay for an additional service for that 1 device? Seems like a failure on Amazons' part in my opinion. Just saying. Maybe try and stop nickel and diming for digital content when were in a recession. Music of all things from the old days shouldnt be something you bogard or monopolize on. Just my opinion.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 5, 2023
reviews: \nOkay so I bit and introduced Alexa into our house. The sound quality is very good in my home office setting. The biggest thing to think about when buying is are you planning to listen to music all day or leaving it on for the dog while you step out? The problem is Alexa will turn off due to inactivity at random, sometimes 15 minutes, sometimes over an hour after it starts playing. I don't care to have a conversation with Alexa every 15 minutes to keep it from shutting down so a radio might be a better option. Another thing is connecting a blue tooth speaker. It is not possible for the Echo Dot 5th generation internal speaker to be on at the same time you have a paired speaker such as my Bose speaker on in another room. The only work around to having music throughout the house is to buy an Echo Dot for wherever you want music, but then you will still be dealing with the shutting down issue due to inactivity. I have read many forums and uninstalling and reinstalling software, sleep timer and telling Alexa to leave on without success.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 20, 2022
reviews: \nRevised rating and review -The 5th Gen Dot - Extender has been neutered.  I turned off the extender function so now I just have an over priced Dot.  The reason I turned off the extender is that I discovered that the speed limitation on the extender is 100mb.  I have 1g service and the extender was causing my Eero system to lag and grind.  C\u2019mon Amazon\u2026..This is a bad deal.  You can and should do better, both in tech and in disclosure.Previous review-When I saw Amazon was coming out with a Dot that could serve as an extender for my Eero setup I jumped on it.  What a great idea.  Amazon has done a great job with Alexa products.  They have gotten easier and easier to set up, and in general they work really well.  This 5th Gen Dot also works well but the extender feature had a few wrinkles.  First, when I initially tried to activate the extender feature it immediately popped up an error message which told me I needed to download and update.  That was odd given I preordered the device and have to believe I am one of the first shipments to go out.  No big thing.  I asked Alexa to update the software and in about 30 minutes it was done.  But then, it still balked when I tried to activate the extender.  Same error message.  I asked Alexa to check for updates again, but she said it was up to date.  I tried a few more times, waited a little while, and it finally connected to the Eero system.  However, it then kept cutting in and out.  It was really unstable.  For whatever tech gremlin reason, it finally seems to have settled in and has been holding on to a WiFi signal for a while.  As is often the case with tech, I expect there will be some additional updates.  We'll see.  We'll also wait and see if this thing does, in fact, work well with the Eero system.  If it doesn't, no big thing.  You can turn that feature off and just use it as a normal Dot.  But I hope it does settle in and work well, because I do think it's a great idea and really nice feature.\n

reviews: \nI am a user who loves Amazon products and I have a whole automation ecosystem armed with Alexa--eero--RingI was very excited about this new version of the Echo Dot, mainly because of the new eero built-in functionality, since I have the eero 6+ all over my house and I wanted to cover a small spot in my house with the echo-dot. However, when trying to use this functionality, I am surprised that it is only available for the United States and Canada. This should be clearly announced in the product description. I hope this is corrected as soon as possible, since it seems to me that it is a very useful functionality and that it adds value to the product.Due to this failure I give it 2 stars onlyAnother flaw in the showiness of the product is the power cord. I bought the black echo-dot and the cable is all white, it looks horrible and shows a lack of attention to detail. My old echo was black and with the black power cable also in a harmonious combination.For the rest, everything works perfectly and I would recommend it with these caveats\n

reviews: \nI thought I would upgrade from my Echo Dot 3rd generation because it was advertised as having better sound. The echo sits up on my counter, when I am sitting on the couch I can't see the light if it is on for messages.  I like the 3rd generation much better because the light was on top and was easy to see. This new generation of echo has a hard time hearing me and understanding me. The 3rd generation dot was not like that at all. I should have returned the item , but stupid me, I threw the box away already. I didn't think I would have to return this item being that I do like the 3rd generation echoes. dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 29, 2023
reviews: \nFor anyone looking to get an Alexa, stay away! After Amazon laid off 10k people, most of whom were on the Alexa team, the quality of Alexa has dropped enormously! I think Amazon also shut off a bunch of servers to reduce cost as well, which is the only thing I can think of for the sudden reduced quality. I have searched the internet and have found that a lot of people are having the same issues as me in the last month. Most of the issues that have recently popped up are:1. Roughly half of the time, Alexa can take a very long time to answer. It is somewhere between 5 and 10 seconds.2. Many times I have to ask Alexa multiple times for it to actually respond.3. Most of the time, the response has nothing at all to do with the question asked so I have to rephrase the question. Sometimes it takes three to five times to rephrase the question. If after the fifth time it doesn't work, I just give up.4. If you own multiple Alexas, there has always been a problem of asking Alexa a question, and it responds on a completely different Alexa. It seems to have gotten much worse lately.I feel like Amazon has given up on Alexa, so it is a sinking ship. I am looking at what other product I can use to replace it with, but am hesitant to go with the other two major brands because they could decide to do the same thing at any point. I am own seven Alexas which I have all over the house so I am very disappointed that I spent all of this money on something Amazon is pulling the plug on.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 30, 2022
reviews: \nBackground info: I have an eero Pro 6 wifi 6 mesh network, several existing echo devices, and a Ring security system. My main reasons for upgrading to this 5th gen model were for the compatibility promised with eero as an extender and as a Ring bridge for my security system.The Eero connectivity and bridge functionality seem to work fine on this device, however it seems to struggle significantly with basic smart home tasks like operating plugs, switches, and lights on command. when asked to turn on or off a light, this device frequently says "device" doesn't support that. However i simply walk over to an older echo device and repeat the command, and that device has no problem performing the action.I'm no network expert but my guess is that this device, which operates on the 5ghz band, does not have proper firmware/software compatibility updates to function seamlessly with smart home items on the 2.4ghz bands. Thus far I haven't been able to find any good solutions to the issue so I'm on the verge of returning the item and sticking with the old Gen 2 device i was using previously.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 30, 2022
reviews: \nAre you kidding me Jeff? My last "Dot" had a 3.5 mm auxiliary out, which means I could upgrade my old stereo with a single cord. Now I have an old stereo, with voice recognition! It's awesome.This "Dot" (5th Gen) has NO OUTPUT AT ALL... Just the power cable.Weirdly enough, the most recent echo has an auxiliary out, as I just found out. Whereas the first generation echo had no auxiliary out, but the first generation Dots DO...When I bought the echo and it didn't have an auxiliary out, I figured it was in beta, and it was a beta thing. When I needed to futurize an old stereo, the Dot did the trick.So when I needed another Dot... I didn't even bother to check if it had a 3.5 mm jack. I'll admit, that's on me, buyer beware. However, I think it would have been helpful to be a little bit more prominent about changes to your products. That way when you go back to buy the product again, you get what you expect, unless it's changed and notated.So I guess the new Echo you plug into your old stereo? While the new Dots, act like standalones like the Echo used to?Still can't get my Amazon Tap (which is an official Echo device) to play with my other Echo devices.Sometimes I can't even get the first generation echo to work with the third generation Dot... Did the internet change or something? The answer is no. Come on Jeff.I can't get the Sonos to work with other Echo speakers, because it's just "Alexa enabled" . Wtf Jeff wtf. Why would you buy a satellite speaker like Sonos, that has Alexa, that doesn't work with any other Alexa products, even though they're on the same darn network? Come on.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 9, 2022
reviews: \nI own several dots and love them. I bought this newest version for only one reason: the Room Temperature Sensor.Here in New England, my kitchen is always slightly colder than the rest of downstairs. I could have bought a Nest Sensor, but replacing my kitchen fit with this version would make it a multi-tasker.Except - IT DOESN'T WORK. It reads 56F constantly. The room, measured by any other thermometer is actually 64F.When I called Echo support, they told me they've received *many* complaints about this, and were just sending out replacements. Sure enough, a new dot arrived the next day. Set it up, waited 24 hours, and.... 56F!Amazon, this was a great idea. Really. Great. But the execution simply doesn't work. True, the sound is nicer than my other dots - and if I were using it as a music speaker That might prove useful. But until you fix this feature so that what you're selling works...This Dot version is not ready for Prime Time. Fail and Return.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 25, 2022
reviews: \nThis thing is a great upgrade over the previous v2/3 we have. The sound is way better for one, BUT it is also a totally redundant piece of junk at the same time, unless you want to invest $120/year to make it worthwhile, which also makes it one of the worst investments you can make.Allow me to explain something which many people already have already realised: A lot of people use this for kitchen timers, weather reports and maybe the occasional fact from Wikipedia, but most people who buy this will want it for an upgrade for sound quality for Amazon Music, and this is where I consider this thing junk.Without any consultation, Amazon have decided to allow normal Prime users full access to the WHOLE 10 (or is it 100?) million song library, with a small catch. You can no longer listen to what you ACTUALLY want to listen to, you have to listen to a shuffle of 1 or 2 songs you want to hear, plus all the random junk in that 10/100 million playlist, and that's a lot of junk.You can no longer listen to your albums you bought WITHOUT shuffle, you can no longer listen to ANY album without shuffle, and you now have to listen to totally random nonsense too. If you used to use Alexa to give your kids a lullaby to go to sleep, they might also get some Sex Pistols mixed in. Sweet Dreams !!UNLESS, you upgrade to unlimited - only $120/year - some would consider that a bargain for a peaceful nights sleep, but considering it was part of Prime but is now locked behind a paywall, I personally have a different view.1 star is all you're getting for this blatant money-grab and betrayal of customer trust !\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 24, 2023
titles: Love the device, when it works.. Support Service with Amazon, has much to be desired
reviews: \nThe device itself, when it works, is great. I have several Alexa devices and love them all. I bought this version of the dot for Christmas on 12/18/22. It was setup and working post holiday until 4/17/23. The device itself will not hold connection to to wifi. I have completed every connection method, rest, hard rest, etc. I have called customer service on 4/21/23 and was told it was outside of the return period so there is nothing that could be done. I would hope the life span of the 5th generation dot would be longer than a 1st gen dot I am still using, but it appears not. I would also hope that Amazon would stand behind product quality and make good on the malfunctioning device, but that does not appear to be the case either.In summary, device is great when working. But don't expect Amazon to stand behind their product after ~4 months of usage and a technical failure.\n

reviews: \nI am a long time and very loyal Amazon customer.  I have an Alexa unit. I wanted to upgrade sound quality and purchased two echo dots.  I could not get Wi-Fi connection. I wrote a constructive letter with a copy of all of my conversations with customer service to the Presidents office at Amazon.This was 5 weeks ago  I have gotten no response in the letter This has been most disappointing I was at least expecting an acknowledgement  This has been my only poor experience with Amazon after many years. I have yet to figure out the connectivity issue or look for other productsI welcome any advice. Thank you\n

reviews: \nRefuses to obey the command "STOP!"  I have to unplug to stop it from playing.  It's getting rather annoying.  The solutions I'm finding to correct this issue are a joke. I am venting about their ignorance in the shipping department her because I can't find any other place to do so.  How hard is it to perform customer service??? reviews: \nI wish I had kept my second and third generation echoes. They at least were able to control my lights with no problems. dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on October 27, 2022
reviews: \nIt might actually be Spotify's problem, but either way, Alexa can't seem to consistently, accurately interact with Spotify. If asked to play a specific playlist, it's about 50/50 whether or not it's the right one. And even when it is, if you ask to skip a song, it goes to a completely different playlist. I'm extremely disappointed, as this was supposed to be a gift for someone, and the main attraction was going to be playing music.Beyond that, setup was fairly simple, and the sound is decent. As a bonus, if you ask Alexa what sound a cat makes, she offers you a "box of cats" to keep. And then tells you that next time all you have to do is say "Alexa, open the box of cats". I'm not kidding.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 30, 2022
reviews: \nI\u2019ll make this brief. 1998 called, and they want their voice recognition technology back.Trying to ask for album titles by name is an exercise in absolute futility 1 time out of 3. I\u2019ll even double check the album title on Amazon Music, read it aloud with impeccable enunciation, and still having an entirety different album play. And this doesn\u2019t even begin to touch on playlists suddenly stopping midstream, devices unsyncing on the Amazon home network, and constantly, like freaking hourly, rebooting my Fire tablet (that\u2019s another review to be written, and it\u2019ll be less kind than this one) so it can connect to the Echo Dots I purchased. Silly me, why on earth did I think devices from the same company would play well together.The price is right, the sound quality is decent, but Alexa is an A B Y S S M A L feat of AI engineering.Look, I love my Kindle, but Amazon is decidedly *not* a technology company based on the performance of these products. Think twice before you get on one of those Blue Origin rockets.Run away as fast as you can, before you find yourself lobbing f-bombs at a computer program half the day.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 7, 2023
reviews: \nI have FIVE Alexa Dots in my house, I just bought the latest and greatest, because I was told, my other Dots can not do offline control. WELL this one cant either!!!How absolutely assinine is it, that when my internet goes out, I can not control my lights, speakers and cameras in my "smart House"I JUST called tech support and got India (Surprise surprise)  this poor lady had no idea what I was asking, she was still saying unplug and plug it. When I hung up.I WANT ALEXA TO CONTROL MY LIGHTS REGARDLESS of internet connection. WHY does the INTERNET even have to know when I turn my lights, cameras or speakers on and off?I have GEN 2, 3, 4 and NOW 5!!! WHY can't I control my Alexa Devices without the internet. I live in Florida, internet goes down all the time, imagine being in your house at night, and not being able to turn the lights on in an emergency.Waste of time and money, If Google Home works without internet you will find all my Alexas in the trash.\n

reviews: \nIt worked well for the first 60/70 days and then it started broadcasting National Public Radio at 7 am every day. I unplugged it again and moved it again, still no connection. On the phone with Amazon right now trying to get a replacement for it. Then the agent told me it was out of warranty OUT OF WARRANTY BY ONE DAY! What kind of con are they running? If I would have called yesterday, I'd get a replacement, but I didn't and got screwed by one day, so they say today. Make of this what you will, I'm not going to go this route again. Unbelievable, and they'll probably want the last payment! This is BS.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 5, 2023
reviews: \nWHAT A JOKE!!.Having it for less than a week and it will be my  LAST voice assistant ever.Eons away from voice assist devices\u2026EONS!Annoying slow and plain stupid.I did not use it for music, house temperature, or calendar.I can access and control it on my phone way faster than Alexa, Don't have patience for her.I use Sonos all over my house with Spotify as my music choice, so Amazon music is useless to me.Alexa speaker is OK for basic info but music, not so much.Having Nest for HVAC and Alexa is too slow for that too.By the time you ask a question that is ALMOST wrong every time you have to tell her to stop and start all over again.Way too much wasted time stopping her when she starts answering wrong and keep asking her more than once for the same questions.Painfully slow, unreliable, useless!UTTERLY DISAPPOINTED!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 18, 2022
reviews: \nI bought this latest Echo Dot to replace an aging first generation Echo that was getting wonky. I also have an Echo Show, so I am no stranger to setting Echos up and using them. That\u2019s why, despite the reviews about trouble setting them up, I thought this would be a breeze. Not even close. After hours of screens that went nowhere, spinning wheels and error messages, I could not get it to connect to WiFi. I did multiple factory resets, and could get as far as the WiFi password screen, and then everything would stop. Finally I called customer support. After an hour with a very pleasant tech, she told me the app must be down, and that I should wait 24 hours and try again.Nope. I initiated a return, boxed it up, and am sending it back. I\u2019ve ordered a cheap third generation Dot instead. For what I use it for, it will be fine. And if not, then it might be time to make the change to Google Home. But this new Dot needs to be dashed.\n

reviews: \nI should have learned with my first Alexa, but I thought\u2026...it could only get better. I was wrong!!! DO NOT BUY ANY OF THESE DEVICES. titles: Don't buy if you want to use as access point (extender)  UPDATES
reviews: \nThe Echo was very simple to set up. My Echo ran a firmware update immediately. I then was asked to update EERO, both updates ran smoothly. I then launched the EERO app and turned on Eero built in. I keep getting error message to check for software update. Already done !  I have jacked with this for over 3 hours. I rebooted Echo and eero and even my modem  The only way to get the error to go away is turn off eero built in. The only reason I bought this junk is to extend WIFI. I recently received ASTRO and have already had issues with that. Not happy Amazon customer.  ****This appears to be a problem with EERO and not the dot. I have an open work order with them to troubleshoot the issue. We were not able to get it working though my initial call. Tam from Amazon was amazing  thanks for caring.  I was shocked that I received a call.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 26, 2022
reviews: \nThe All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen) has quickly become a staple in my smart home setup. The device is compact, easy to set up, and has a sleek modern design that fits perfectly into any room.One of the standout features of the Echo Dot is its voice control capabilities. With Amazon's virtual assistant, Alexa, I can control my smart home devices, play music, and get answers to my questions simply by using my voice. It's a convenient and hassle-free way to stay connected and in control of my home. For example, I can turn off the lights in my bedroom or adjust the thermostat without ever having to leave my couch. I can also ask Alexa to play my favorite playlist or set a timer for when I'm cooking dinner. The options are endless and it's amazing how much easier it has made my daily routine.In addition to its voice control capabilities, the Echo Dot also has impressive sound quality. It's clear and crisp, making it perfect for streaming music or listening to audiobooks. I particularly love using it to listen to podcasts or music while I'm working or relaxing at home.Overall, I highly recommend the All-New Echo Dot (5th Gen) to anyone looking to upgrade their smart home or add voice control to their home. It's a game-changing device that I use on a daily basis and has made my life so much more convenient. The setup process is a breeze and the device is very user-friendly, so even if you're not tech-savvy, you'll have no problem getting it up and running. If you're on the fence about purchasing the Echo Dot, I can confidently say that it's worth the investment. You won't be disappointed!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 5, 2023
titles: A Must-Have for Any Smart Home
reviews: \nHad issues getting to know my hue light but tech support is 5 star and got me the information which allowed me to work out the issue myself. Great learning session. I use it everyday for weather, news, even sleep sounds: I found brown noise is relaxing but pink noise makes vivid dreaming! Nice side effect. I am planning my expension and building a smart system. Very cool and handy even for this 66 yo techhead!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 29, 2022
titles: Game Changer and sooo much fun!
reviews: \nI bought the Alexa in white for my 12 year old daughter for Christmas...now I want one for myself! First of all, we already have one Alexa in the house that belongs to my 16 year old son and he mostly uses it for listening to music and controlling his bluetooth LED lights and lightbulb in his room! My daughter didn't ask for the Alexa, but since she does have the bluetooth lights in her room, I figured she may enjoy being able to do voice control commands like her brother. I also ordered her a bluetooth lighbulb for her ceiling fan that works with Alexa! She has had an absolute blast controlling the lights in her room; the bulb I ordered can do every possible shade of color under the Sun...so my daughter is literally in her room like, "Alexa change my light to hot pink...Alexa change my light to beige..." It is SO cool! When she can't sleep, she simply says, "Alexa play meditative storm sounds" and Alexa replies with her options... for FREE of course! We can also ask her to read my daughter a bedtime story and she reads a story. Her Dad and I even creeped by her room and said really loud, "Alexa, play ZZ TOP!" just to annoy her lmao It's been so much fun and Alexa, like Siri, can answer just about any question or complete just about any task you ask of her. Definitely a quality purchase and worth every penny!\n

titles: My older one has better bass !
reviews: \nI\u2019m ok with the new one ,only because I can link the two together ( I\u2019m really not happy with the $50 price tag for a clock \u2026. 19,00 the eco dot that looks like cool hockypuch. IMO has better sound, smaller more logical for the sound. There is no reason to buy this generation ( at least the one I have in the photo ) the basic version with a clock . It has honestly been more of a hassle than it\u2019s worth . I\u2019m a big fan of Amazon Prime, and ring .as for this generation after owning it for about a year . I would gladly trade it for another generation earlier; ( that\u2019s a slam dunk for the money) I have a clock on my phone wall and wrist ( like every one else in the world lol) so save your money and get the I believe it\u2019s 3rd generation. The one before they went to the orb type . The older one has not failed. And it will be sane or better then this one ! I can\u2019t say anything bad for Amazon as a whole ( I\u2019m sure I cold have returned it ( but it\u2019s here so I use it ) I linked the two and old faithful is still playing as the orb 4 generation fails to connect with the original or the internet also , where the 3rd gen will run on a spot or router! The new one has to be close to the router. Where 3gen this is not a problem at all!  Need less to say if you are thinking about a good eco dot . The older one will definitely be better for you .\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 27, 2022
reviews: \nIn the bedroom I have a projector that I use to play on the wall TV shows and late night news before I go to bed the projector is one of those cheap projectors from China. It\u2019s a good projector however it has its flaws. The sound quality is absolute crap and the fan is loud. I eventually got used to the mono sound (which had to be turned up because the fan is so loud) I recently got the new echo 5 gen and fire stick 4k max during primeday. I and what a complete 180\xb0 difference it is. You can connect the echo with the fire stick and use that as the audio! At first I was worried about there being a delay and the voice not being in sync since I was using a projector. Never had an issue. I have excellent sound now and I\u2019m planning on purchasing another echo to have a both sides of the bed. If anyone uses a projector with a Firestick I highly suggest you get this echo for your sound to replace the projector speakers.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 7, 2022
titles: Loss of the audio jack is a deal breaker
reviews: \nGet a few 4rth generation dots now while they're 40% off, because the 5th gen ones have lost their audio jack, and the "enhanced sound" is really just a trick of equalization.  If you raise the sound above 7 or 8, whatever software adjustments they made to the sound output cause the music to "pop" - and not in the good way.  More along the lines of "this speaker wasn't meant to output this level of sound".Maybe the above doesn't matter to you, and that's fine.  The 5th gen has some things you might want, like temperature sensor or the ability for it to tell when you enter a room (though that's a bit creepy - can we opt-out of that data collection?).  For me, the lack of an audio jack means you have to deal with the latency in the bluetooth audio experienced with some improperly calibrated bluetooth speakers.  I'd rather have all my music-linked echos play music synchronized.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 7, 2022
reviews: \nThis echo device works just as you would expect. It connects to Alexa and plays your music and can run commands. I just use this as a speaker and a kitchen timer. I don't really need to do any of the other features such as routines and shopping. Works just fine as an always-on speaker. I bought these as cheap gifts for Christmas for the kids - they might find more use out of these.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 12, 2023
titles: Why do they keep making these with FEWER microphones with every new Generation?
reviews: \nThe thing cannot hear us.  The old Generation 1 Echo Dots can hear our voices much much better than the newer ones.  Why do they keep making these with FEWER microphones with every new Generation?  The Echo Show devices are extremely expensive, and they are EVEN WORSE at hearing your voice.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 16, 2023
titles: *DO NOT BUY* One of the glitchiest/unresponsive set of devices I've ever owned
reviews: \nDon't really like Amazons smart speakers at all, 2 out of 15 stars basically, only reason for 2 is the audio is pretty good. The voice recognition is downright terrible, often you have to yell at it because if you have the volume up louder than 4(goes to 10), it can't hear you over it's own audio, you have to stand right in front of the device and yell at it to get it to listen to you. Google doesn't have this issue, you can whisper to Google while it's at full volume from across the room, and it will still hear you.If you have more than one device integrated into your home, be prepared to expect commands worse than talking to a toddler. I have a speaker in my kitchen, and one in my living room. If I want to pause amazon music in the kitchen after cooking, and transfer the music over to my living room to eat, forget it. I've only gotten this feature to ever work twice, all the other times, it will revert to whatever music was played last on that particular speaker.In short, I'm completely baffled as to why Amazon doesn't invest more time into these smart speakers, they could be phenomenal, but, instead Amazon only invests money on the data mining aspect of the devices, as Alexa is CONSTANTLY making suggestions of what you should buy on Amazon, ex: you are talking about dishes with a friend in your house, MAGICALLY suggested Amazon purchases are a bunch of dishes on your phone/computer. I 100% honestly wouldn't even care about this complete invasion of privacy, if the devices actually worked somewhat okay. The one and only reason we've kept them is because they were a wedding gift, and that's pretty much it, they suck. They never understand you, they answer your questions poorly, they get confused and then ask you more questions, and still can't figure out how to respond to your first question.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 22, 2023
reviews: \nsave your money\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 16, 2023
titles: App is horrible! It never does even the simplest tasks
reviews: \nI don't understand how echo has not gotten any better over the years. False promises of being able to improve on already existing features. Or when it does work sure enough a week later an update will break the feature.It never plays music and constantly unlinks spotify and apple music accounts.Forgets where podcasts last stopped.To play a specific song although I have spotify or apple music as the main music app in the echo app settings is just never possible. It constantly insist on amazon music and just plays a radio instead. Like what is the point of having those options there for years and never gotten around to making it work?Its inconceivably bad how even within its echo/amazon eco system it CAN'T carry out tasks consistently. The echo to firestick which you would assume be something that they would have streamlined to be functional. Ooooh you can guarantee that 95% of the time it will not do that or push something else such as buying a movie or tv series to be bought on prime video smh. It will pull you out of an app your using like youtube example given belowThe simplest things like "search (youtube channel name) on youtube" as an example command, to a linked firestick is just not doable everything has to be typed out practically on your remote.The point of having an echo is just to be a glorified alarm clock. Which even that can be annoying if the volume is to loud. It won't hear you say the wake work "echo" and then say "stop alarm". So your left with having to yell "ECHO!!!" for it to hear you which will have you woken up if the alarm itself isn't enough.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 16, 2023
reviews: \nI regret buying and receiving these products as gifts. They all malfunction often. The more you get the more they don\u2019t work. I had four different devices in my house and they all malfunction. I even bought an echo dot and that doesn\u2019t work at all now. I reached out to customer service and they said to buy another and return the old one. They ask you to do the basic troubleshooting which is common sense but when it doesn\u2019t work they don\u2019t have any solutions. Just a scam. They know these devices are barely functional and they haven\u2019t worked out all the kinks yet they still sell them. They connect and disconnect from Bluetooth devices when they want. The play on the \u201ceverywhere\u201d group (all Alexa speakers) never works and it cuts the music off after a few minutes. Literally two of my devices are inoperable. Also, they\u2019re not smart. You can ask the device a question, something simple and it\u2019ll give you three different answers from contributors. I want an answer from a reliable source not a contributor that\u2019s just guessing. Save your money and frustration buy a Google device or better yet a normal Bluetooth enable speaker that you can connect your phone to.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on April 18, 2023
titles: Amazon is losing money on Alexa and taking it out on the customer
reviews: \nMy echo lately doesn't respond frequently, and has to be rebooted. And as I learned this week, if the servers go down your echo becomes a paper weight. It also constantly advertises to me and constantly makes suggestions I don't want. Wish I had invested in Google Home instead.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 4, 2023
titles: The most annoying device I have ever owned
reviews: \nIt functioned perfectly in every way, but the incessant intrusions and questions every time I ever asked Alexa anything were infuriating. One time I said "Alexa, can you turn off the light" and the response I got was "Yes, would you also like for me to set up a weekend celebration routine?" No, Alexa. I do not, and never want to, set up whatever a weekend celebration routine is.Random, unhelpful suggestions at every turn. Insufferable. I've switched my home to Google and don't get any of the nonsense I did with Alexa. Best decision I have ever made, I now feel more calm as a person.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 28, 2023
reviews: \nGood luck keeping it connected to your devices or having the ability to pair back to them easily.  Pretty bad interface and lousy support. I'm definitely moving to Google next.\n

reviews: \nHad this for 2 months now. It stops playing whenever it feels like. Then says due to inactivity. It's in a 13 by 20 room and we think the sound is terrible. The older Alexa we have sounds much better. Very disappointed.\n

titles: DO NOT BUY ANY AMAZON ECHO PRODUCTS
reviews: \nOVER THE YEARS I'VE PURCHASED ABOUT 15 ECHO PRODUCTS AND WISH I NEVER DID.  THEY USED TO WORK WELL HOWEVER AMAZON IS GETTING INCREDIBLY  GREEDY AND MORE PETTY.  EVEN THOUGH YOU PAY EXTRA FOR THE MUSIC SERVICE, THE MACHINE TURNS OFF AFTER COUPLE SONGS STATING "NO ACTIVITY ON THE DEVICE".  APPARENTLY YOU ARE REQUIRED TO TALK TO THE THING BETWEEN EVERY SONG.  AND NOW, WHEN YOU ASK FOR A PARTICULAR ARTIST, IT WON'T AND STATES IT WILL PLAY "SIMILAR ARTISTS".  AGAIN, THEY USED TO WORK WELL, NOW THE ARE HORRIBLE.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 4, 2023
titles: New update this and that\u2026.don\u2019t bother\u2026
reviews: \nI had an Alexa echo 3rd gen, the 2018 release. It is really old so I decided to buy a new one. Well, this one isn\u2019t so much better. Voice recognition is awful. Whenever I said, \u201cAlexa, how\u2019s the weather\u201d or, \u201cAlexa, play this years top 40\u201d it would keep saying, \u201csorry I don\u2019t understand\u201d over and over. And the plugs? Total safety hazard. Maybe mine just arrived in really bad shape, but when I asked Alexa for the 100th time to play music, and it listened, halfway through a song it BUSTED A WIRE in my house. Do not buy this you are better off with and Apple HomePod mini.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 8, 2023
reviews: \nI will not recommend any Alexa devices! I'll be standing inches away and have to yell to the top of my lungs but if I'm in a separate room and talk it a normal to low voice it hears me. Not only that but it answers sometimes it answers to things that sounds nowhere close to 'alexa' and the voice recognition sucks!\n

reviews: \nLe dices una cosa y hace otra\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 13, 2023
titles: Don't buy this piece of Junk save your money for future chat gpt devices.
reviews: \nAbout 95% of the time, this machine will get your instructions wrong. Customer service is absolutely no help, and has no idea how to use the device themselves. Please save yourself the money and wait for something like chat GPT to become a home assistant. This is the only device in my house that actually makes me "angry," so I'm getting rid of it as soon as possible. Trust me; it is better to get up and flip a switch than to shout at Alexa 7 times to cut off a light, only for her to tell you that she doesn't understand you.  This machine is just a giant exercise in frustraion, and I now halfway believe the company is testing how far they can push their customers before they start shouting at their little black box.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on March 3, 2023
reviews: \nThis product is absolutely terrible and next to impossible to set up. I\u2019ve tried to setup my echo 15 different times and it has yet to work. Support was not helpful whatsoever. I reset my echo, my phone and my wifi router. I\u2019ve followed all of the instructions from the app and amazon support and it still doesn\u2019t work. Don\u2019t waste your money on such a terrible product.\n

reviews: \nI have enjoyed using this Echo Dot for some time now, bit I am extremely disappointed that the music selection process has changed. This change apparently has come about due to a grab for additional money from Amazon. This is a slap in the face to your loyal customers. I spend a lot of money with Amazon and am a Prime member, but I don\u2019t intend to spend more just to line Amazon\u2019s pockets. Shame on you!\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 29, 2022
titles: Best sounding with neutered amazon music
reviews: \nIt may sound better, but you may not like what you're having to listen to. Amazon might have spun recent changes to Amazon Music like a good thing, but what they did was remove:* the ability to specify a specific song* the ability to replay a song you're currently listening to* the ability to play a specific artistUnless... you pay even more! The most practical product they stopped making was the small echo dot with the built in clock. That was a decent alarm clock, especially with some aftermarket battery backups. I don't like these larger products, and I have much better speakers anyway.\n
config_color: Color: Deep Sea BlueConfiguration: Device only

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on November 27, 2022
titles: Will no longer play albums and playlists of music purchased from Amazon.
reviews: \nI purchased one of these as a gift.  Now I'm sorry I did.  After the recent Alexa "upgrade," Amazon devices will no longer play albums or playlists of music that HAS BEEN PURCHASED FROM AMAZON. All that work creating playlists of music for relaxation, sleep, exercise, and favorite artists in various groupings, all of that is suddenly GONE from the Alexa service. Likewise, if one requests to hear an album that is in MY library purchased from Amazon, she insists on saying that she is going to shuffle other music by "similar artists" along with my albums that I DO NOT want to listen to and ignores my playlists completely. Mind you, these are requests for music purchased from Amazon. Just saying that again so it's clear. Then, when making a music request, Alexa frequently makes one listen to long ads for buying her expensive music service . You know, if you request to hear your music, you really want to hear that and not the same annoying ad you've heard a million times about a product you will never buy, and then some random music you didn't request. I loved being able to listen to my music just by asking for it and have purchased Echo devices for almost every room in the house. Now that I can't do that anymore, all those hardware and music purchases seem very much like bait-and-switch to me and I feel very ripped off.  Now I would feel bad about buying this as a gift, since I assume it would have the same sad behavior I experience at home and just provide irritation.  To say that I am very, very unhappy with Amazon dropping these functions would be an understatement. Looking for other options.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on February 16, 2023
reviews: \nIt constantly loses connection to the wifi even though there are no internet issues. One day it works and the next it doesn't. Super frustrating having to reset the wifi each damn time.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on January 1, 2023
titles: Flakey operation and other issues Regret the purchase
reviews: \nBrought 5 of these before I discovered how flaky they are.I constantly have to reset network connection parameters after a internet drop out or I suffer a power issue.  Alexa voice and music volume are controlled by a single setting. When I increase volume to hear voice response music is far too loud, when I reduce volume to listen to music alexa voice is too quiet.  No way to turn off nagging ad notices.  One a positive note sound quality is very good.  But...I REGRET EVER BUYING THIS PRODUCT. Based on design limitations, I don't recommend it to any one.\n

titles: Does NOT allow access to CD's that you have purchased on Amazon
reviews: \nWhen I bought my first echo device, I assummed that the phrase "Amazon Music" meantthat I would have access to all of the CD's that I have purchased on Amazon.  That isNOT true.  What you get is access to streaming services, which pay a pittance to theartists.  I want to play an entire album that I have purchased, or better yet selecta particular cut from a particular album.  In short, I want to be the one whodetermines what I listen to, not some anonymous algorithm.  I'm very disappointed.\n

dates: Reviewed in the United States \U0001f1fa\U0001f1f8 on December 8, 2022
reviews: \nThe echo ecosystem was wonderful when we got into it 6 or more years ago I don't remember exactly when we got our first one but it was around the time my youngest sone was born. You could link it up to a variety of services and be able to listen to your music audiobooks and get an answer to most questions throughout the day. Now it's riddled with suggestions, some of the old music streaming options don't work correctly anymore. And the "upgraded" prime music experience is a huge step in reverse. If you don't buy all the adding to go with it it's not worth your money to get started. I'll be looking to replace our dots and echo speakers with HomePod Mini's in the not so distant future due to these recent "upgrades". I already pay for several add-on services for my amazon devices through amazon because they are genuinely good but please amazon stop give us downgrades and calling them the opposite.\n
